result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon D. Mason

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8:40 a.m.  Defendant does not appear. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf55 and 15cf54. Bennett - it has been 2 weeks since he has talked to client; there was an incident of domestic violence since then and has had no contact. Michlig- new charges have been filed - warrant has been issued on new charges. Court authorizes warrant in these matters. Bennett - motion to withdraw from 15cf55 and 15cf54 - denied, but taken under advisement. Adj. 8:42 a.m.

Attorney Brian Bennett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
2:49
Stipulation to 15cf55 going forward first as trial then 15cf54 to follow victim case to be tried first

2:48 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55. Bennett statement that cases are not resolved - requests jury trial for 15cf54. 15cf55 set for status conference to track with 15cf54. Adj. 2:52 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.   Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55.  Bennett states defendant has scheduled psychological evaluation which will be pertinent to any negotiations/PSI - requests date for jury trial or pre-trial conference. Michlig statement to pretrial date. Adj. 1:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:38 p.m. Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55 - In receipt of Information - waive reading - enters not guilty plea - Bail continued. Adj. 3:40 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Adj. 3:41 p.m.
PC from Jonathon - in WMHF- unable to leave - has contacted attorney Bennetts office and informed them that he will not able to be in court Monday

Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:48
Proceeded with 15cf54 previously - 
State calls deputy Bethany Van Dooren/Sworn/direct - witness IDs defendant/Court questions witness
Court statement - Court finds probable cause exists and binds over 
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Current: 639 Coolidge Ave, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2015)
Prior: 2812 Germond Road, Rhinelander, WI 54501
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court via video  with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:44
Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55
In receipt, waive readings - set for preliminary hearings - time limits not waived
Bennett statement to bail - Victim in 15cf55 present in court- gives statement - Schiek statement - Court statement - Court modifies to $1000 cash - Court strikes the no contact provision - 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathon D. Mason in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:57
Calling 15cf54 and 15cf55
In receipt of both complaints, right to counsel - would like counsel/PD
Schiek statement to bail - Defendant statement - Schiek statement - victim's mother spoke to him -   Court sets $   bond  
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
